audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[31]:: Every story has a major question. What's the question you've answered at the end of your item?
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[10]:: Hit record before you ask a question to record a few seconds of silence before speaking.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[30]:: If it is windy, point your camera away from the wind, or protect your mic.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[2]::: Do some research before the interview when possible. You will ask better, more relevant questions.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[3]::: Have a one-sentence explanation of your story for your characters.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[21]:: Ask only one question at a time.
audio_stories::quiz_card_topic::choices[: A Day in the Life Story
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[1]::: When shooting in dangerous situations always have an exit strategy.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[14]:: Even if time is limited, make a plan, do not shoot everything you see.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[20]:: Always know what you want from the interview.
audio_stories::quiz_card_topic::question: Choose the story you want to make.
audio_stories::text_card_0::text: Making a great audio story involves a variety of clips. These templates will guide you to get all the clips you need to tell a variety of stories.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[25]:: Don't ask 'closed' questions that can be answered in one word such as 'yes' or 'no'.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[24]:: Listen for background noise that may harm the quality of your story before you click record.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[0]::: Know yourself, be aware of your biases don't let them influence how you portray your story.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[5]::: Prioritize your questions and identify the single, most essential bit of information you need.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[11]:: Check your audio level using headphones before you start recording.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[23]:: Courtesy can help establish trust and improve your interviews.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[22]:: Ask hard questions, but remember to be polite. A polite request will go a long way.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[16]:: Focus on a single primary topic to tell a concise and clear story.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[26]:: Keep the conversation moving. Ask: Why? What happened next? What do you mean?
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[29]:: Remember, without good sound your images only tell half the story.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[15]:: When recording an interview, prepare at least 15 questions.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[27]:: If your questions do not provide a satisfactory answer, change your approach.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[8]::: Your story will be more interesting if you interview characters with opposing viewpoints.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[18]:: Be clear about your topic or goal when requesting an interview.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[12]:: Use your own voice as little as possible, tell the story through the voices of others.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[9]::: Shoot different size shots to create an effective sequence.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[6]::: Get to the most important question quickly in the interview.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[7]::: In your interview, remember to be tough but fair.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[17]:: Record first hand observations and interviews whenever possible.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[19]:: Be calm. Relaxing will help your interview subject relax too.
audio_stories::title: Make an Audio Story
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[4]::: Save sensitive questions for the end.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[32]:: A climax is the answer on the question that keeps your listener listening. Don't give it away too early.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[33]:: Ask yourself for every clip: does it tell me something new?
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[13]:: Think about the audience you want to reach when considering what Topic and Format to use.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[28]:: Use follow-up questions if you need more information.
audio_stories::tip_collection::tips[34]:: A good series should be made up of five strong images. If you have more good shots, add them in though.
